intro: Scleranthus brockiei, commonly known as the rock sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its stems are generally erect and branched, with a rough, hairy texture. Scleranthus brockiei is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
